reviews.review_text: Nicole & Trevor are an absolute treat! We had an amazing experience with incredible food & drink, Nicole s house blend of vermouth was out of this world!! We cant thank you enough for having us and making our trip to BC so much brighter !!! Not only was the service AMAZING, the food was incomparable. We left full and happy!

This restaurant seems to be always busy. Just one bite at the food and you will understand why. If you prefer quality over quantity, this is the place to be. The chef is passionate about excellent food and unorthodox flavours. Ask the server about some of his creations outside the regular menu, like the pork Jowl. You will be pleasantly surprised.
Its good place, I have been here two times. Always good even dessert was pretty good! We were 4ppl, share food :) Food : 5/5

One of the more amazing and intimate places to chat and dine around amazing tapas. Definitely recommend the steak, pork loin, potato bravas, and garlic shrimp. If you re unsure, just ask for the most popular dishes and they ll take care of you. Reservations recommended.

Had to wait a bit for our table to get ready but the host and server were super friendly and helpful. Once we sat down we had a great experience. Incredible food, wine list and service. Might seem a bit pricey but you can tell they care about the food and its definitely worth jt

You guys, when I say this is one of the best restaurants I have been in Vancouver!!!! I love how you can just order a bunch of different appetizers and share with your whole party. The flavor of every dish is so special and rich. (It makes you think you are in Spain indeed) Everyone that works here is so sweet and makes the experience even better. 20/10
Como taperia is a vibe. Delicious food. Spot on drinks. And a really fun and uplifting atmosphere. The paella events are definitely worth checking out.

Ive gone by this place so many times and never thought to look inside because the blinds are always turned! Its a vibe in there, for sure but space is tight so I recommend getting a reso. Food was served tapas (small plates) style and was absolutely fresh delicious. The pork neck was my favourite. Second favourite was the eggplant which was seasoned nicely. The octopus was also cooked to perfection. We were only 2 people so we got full fast. I recommend bringing friends and going as a group of 3 or 4 to try more things and more seafood.

One of my favorite places to eat. Great patatas brava. The steak was great cooked perfectly. Jamon iberico was nice and light good flavor although for the price I would have liked it carved fresh over pre portioned. Good drink menu. Service was a little slow and busy.

21.10.22 This was quite a tasteful experience. I love Tapas because you are able to taste a lot as the portions are small. I highly suggest visiting this area for a great experience. The atmosphere is not of fine dining, but, rather more casual. However the dishes are quite fine! Oh, and not to forget, their cheesecake is so soft and fine, it melts in your mouth - must try!  (not pictured)

Incredible....INCREDIBLE. Amazing food, beautiful menu - what lies off the menu (specials, etc) are where the true beauty lies, but absolutely do not sleep on the tapas, the tinned seafood, and regular (and by no means is this food regular) menu. I wont speak to the food specifically - it speaks for itself and the talent in the kitchen is dazzling. Our server was knowledgeable, they showed passion regarding the food, the drink, and the energy give-and-take was incredible. We received a lovely gift from our server and, quite honestly, they delivered in conversation even more so. Last but not least: sangria on tap - need I say more?

I first dined at Como Taperia when I found out that one of the partners was a friend of mine Shaun Layton from being in the restaurant industry. He is amazing and well-experienced in all aspects from being creative with his talents and charm to treating ALL his guests with VIP service and making his guests welcome. So when I went to visit him and dine at Como Taperia, he and his team exceeded all my expectations and this restaurant is one of my favourites. The creative genius from the Chef s menu is delicious and offers a unique variety of taps dishes and an emphasis on sharing. One of my ultimate favourite dishes is the Chef s chilli peppers and a must order as well as the croquettes to start. The Spanish paella is another delicious dish and anything from their specialty meat dishes. Since Shaun is very knowledgeable about spirits and wine Como Taperia has unique wine selections and all priced reasonably. The servers are friendly and professional and know the menu to offer suggestions to what the customer is in the mood to try. The restaurant opens at 4pm and a lineup of eager customers to get in and a constant flow of customers throughout the night. I went recently for my Birthday with two dear friends who hadn t been before and after our amazing fun evening and special VIP attention from my friend Shaun, he gained two more customers and their new favourite restaurant. I can always count on a memorial experience at Como Taperia and highly recommend anyone to visit and enjoy all that Como Taperia has to offer. Thank you to Shaun and his team as I really appreciate it.
Great food, good tapas and nice drinks. The staff is amazing, super friendly.

Wow! A place Ive walked by too many times... Not anymore after last nights drop in. The food here is seasoned n put together very well. We ordered about 8 things and it was all so good. Cocktails were to die for. Everything here is small plates (tapas) so dont expect to come have a full dinner. But definitely great spot for snacks and chat with friends. Service was very good. Yes a bit pricey but worth every penny!

Simply loved everything about this restaurant as it provides a true nostalgic experience of Spain. The food is simply delicious. Order a few different things and share. Also really loved the different cocktails they have. I ll definitely be back next time I am in Vancouver again.

We ate dinner here on our last night (Sunday) in Vancouver (were from LA). It was a 7min walk from our Bnb so that was initial reason why we ate here. Its a small dining space but luckily there was space for the 2 of us at the bar. The bar tender/server was also very helpful when trying to order. We ordered the goat cheese stuffed peppers, the deep fried eggplant, the clams, the garlic shrimp, and the pork belly. Wow everything was delicious and spaced out perfectly. I was especially fond of the goat cheese peppers and eggplant! I actually still dream of this meal and hope to visit again soon just to eat here! I hope to find something as good as this place in LA! 10/10 would recommend.
Food is good, service is friendly, the music is too loud there.

I ve been looking forward to coming here for awhile, finally got the time and made a reservation  it did not disappoint. Absolutely fantastic food, had a great time there, the staff was knowledgeable and very nice, great drinks and overall a great experience. They opened at 4 and the place was packed by 415. I loved it and can t wait to go back!

Terrific food and atmosphere! We tried the croquetas, patatas bravas, fried eggplant and special steak an were pleasantly impressed by everything! Ut was great getting to share everything and get to try several things. The music was amazing and whole vibe of the place very lively. We also loved the basque cheesecake. Make sure you book ahead of time as it gets pretty busy on the weekends.

It s really packed and tight seating, but vibes and atmosphere were great! We came here after our round 1 dinner. Staff were great, friendly and attentive. Food was above average, enjoyed the tapas for sure. Wine was a bit pricey. The dining experience was satisfying.

Everything was delicious, it reminded me of being in Barcelona. Honestly Im not a huge fan of olives and I was worried that I wouldnt like the food but it wasnt an issue at all. We mostly ordered all our food from the main menu. There was a seperate one that consisted a wife variety of canned items. I would say that I thought the place would be cuter inside from the looks outside but it was just alright. It felt like we were sitting in a little supermarket.

This restaurant is like teleporting to the Basque region of Spain! Difficult to choose between a wide selection of Conservas with daily specials while leaving room for the famous Burnt Basque Cheesecake

I love this place. Always great food and service. The must haves are: The torreznos, the patatas bravas, the bikini sando, and shishito peppers. The rest of the menu is great, but I always get these dishes to start. I love the Vermut on tap, and the  non - alcoholic drinks are great too. Todo es delicioso! Si pudiera ir todos los dias, ahi estaria.

Our friends in Vancouver took us there. Because of the nature of this restaurant it was not kids friendly, but we managed to have 1 baby and 2 small kids with us! Food was really good and I loved most of the dishes! Is grown ups enjoyed our alcoholic beverages with the food! The restaurant was pretty busy but wait staff there were friendly.
Loved out server, Javier!  Great atmosphere, delicious marinated olives, sardines with chips (very good!! Especially if you like the taste of tuna), and the best honey glazed eggplant.

It s a nice cozy (tight but good) space for small plates and good drinks. Liked the chicken liver, the squid and also the steak. Service was very friendly and bar guy was super helpful. Would go back again, but not often thanks to the steep prices.

The vibe is real.  Walking in, I immediately picked up that this restaurant serves fun along with its food and drink. Smiling hard-working staff delivering tapas plates to laughter filled tables. The food quality lived up to the hype. The cocktails were well balanced. We had 12 share plates for the 4 of us. Biggest wins were croquettes, stuffed peppers, patatas bravas. Go there expecting fun, not quiet conversation. Dietary restrictions: Lots of decent Gluten Free choices
Beautiful experience. Fun yet classy vibe. Great clams, tomato bruschetta was surprisingly phenom. The octopus was also fantastic

It was our first time there, and nothing disappointed! Great, and lively atmosphere, and amazingly delicious tapas! Dates with prosciutto and walnuts, sardines with potato chips, crispy delicious eggplant with spicy honey and sea salt, goat cheese stuffed peppers, patatas bravas, potato and cheese croquettes,  to name a few. Nice selection of non alcoholic beverages,  and a lovely cheesecake with rhubarb compote for dessert. Absolute perfection across the board. Cant wait to return! Oh yes, and wonderful service by the entire staff!

Came here are they are ranked top 100 restaurant canada. Ordered almost every single dish in their warm tapas menu. Every single dish was familiar to us, being born in Southeast Asia, but with a little of their own unique twist. If you like Japanese Izakaya, youll like this!

This is the best place to go if you like to try a variety of things. Really yummy dishes for sharing and great drinks! Cool atmosphere and vibe. Theres usually a decent wait here, but you can have a drink at the bar and olives or other little snacks while you wait for a table which is nice. Pretty sure they take reservations if you plan ahead.
My wife and I had some cocktails & snacks last night and, as always, Como delivers. Great food, service is always tight and a great vibe in the room. A staple for Vancouver!

I had a great time visiting last night. The croquettes took me back to the streets of Madrid and the Sangria tasted identical to my favorite spot in Granada. I especially loved the Gilda and the Pan Con Tomate ( bread with tomato ) which reminded me of my favourite breakfast spot in Colmenar. I will be back to taste it all! The space has an awesome atmosphere with seated and standing options to perch at the bar a drool over the tapas. The service was friendly and fast! Looking forward to being a local here. Thanks team Como
Beautiful tapas dinner at Como! We picked 4 tapas and server nailed it with 5th choice. Tequila/Mezcal cocktails and cider were delicious. Super attentive service. Would absolutely come again!

This place is brilliant. Menu has evolved since I went there a few years ago... Really sublime. I always try and sit at the bar as its really engaging with the staff and you feel like youre having tapas in Palomos on the coast of Spain. This is a must go in Vancouver destination.
This place is just incredible. Fresh delicious food and well mixed drinks. A must visit when in Vancouver. Food

I have been wanting to come forever and it did not disappoint. It is definitely a popular spot so make a reso! Prices and portions are  definitely reasonable. Food tastes great! Tried tye chorizo and croquetas both delicious Ordered and drink and cant believe how big it is. Will be returning

Came here after a dinner for drinks and small bites, small/intimate casual spot with great vibes. Service was super friendly, food was delicious. Will definitely be back to explore more of the menu. Vancouver needs more places like this!
Very authentic. Wife loved the sangria, and comparing it to Barcelona. Peppers were really hot for me. Everything yum.
Delicious food and vibrant restaurant scene.  Especially loved the pork entree. Highly recommend!

I had a great experience dining here, nice tapas style meals, great drink list and good service. Some of the food is a little bit on the pricey side but the overall experience is worth it. The restaurant has a really nice feel to it and greet location!

Our experience at Como Taperia was nothing short of exceptional, Shout out and thanks to Chef Raf and his team, He tailored our meals to perfection, ensuring every bite was a delightful surprise.we knew we were in expert hands. His passion for cooking was evident in every dish, the steak was hella bomb! Im not exaggerating but Fogo de Chao, Peter Luger, House of Prime Rib and Ruth Chris taste like a fancy McDonald s compare to his steak. Wed also like to give a special shout-out to our servers, Olivia and Ashwone, who added the perfect touch to our night, making it truly unforgettable.

A little of this and a little of that... made my night special. Thanks to our server for hitting the Mark... both you and TJ deserve a shout out. ;) Top surf: Garlic prawns Top canned: Spanish mackerel Top Turf: Steak frites Top Drank: Motor Blanc

This is a wonderful Spanish bar where you can have authentic Spanish Tapas, tasty morsels on small plates,  you have with drinks. The shrimps cooked in garlic olive oil (gambas) are really tasty.  The calamares (squid) is cooked just right crunchy crust with tender, not rubbery squid inside. Theres Iberico ham. Have these with one of the best sangrias in town. There are also these very interesting fried chili peppers which are mild, but 1 in 10 is really hot, but you dont know which. Its like a food Russian roulette. A really fun drinking game among friends. Unfortunately with Covid restrictions, it could only be a dad and older kids game.
Food so delicious and very nice sharing amount. Staff very courteous and well knowledgeable on what to pick to eat
The Happy Hour as fantastic good food good wine great service. Highly recommended
Como is amazing. Like it brings you back to Spain. The negroni is top notch. As is their options and their garlic shrimp. Beware, all these small tapas plates add up quick. But so good!
Amazing food and service!! Loved the experience. Felt like i was actually in Spain. I highly recommend this place!

Loved this place! The food, service, casual vibe ... its perfect. We tried various tapas but the eggplant definitely wins the prize! It was also a pleasant surprise to see that they serve Alhambra beer.
Love it! Best place to have a vermu with tortilla in Vancouver. The service is great and the place is relaxing and comfy, perfect for a night out with friends.

Had the shishito peppers, fried eggplant, t-bone, and garlic shrimp. Dessert was basque cheesecake. All outstanding, can t say enough good things about how flavorful everything is. Amazing. Sangria was also refreshing.

Had the most amazing time at Como. Service was outstanding, vibes were through the roof, food was excellent and drinks were delicious. We were at the standing table in front of the kitchen and we had a blast. Thanks Como!!

Loved the vibrant atmoshere and service by staff.  Each tapas dish offered a unique experience to the palette with something for everyone. l really enjoyed the Sangria and would urge them to consider offering this in a pitch in addition to a glass.
Came to check out this Spanish spot during happy hour. Nice vibrant gem, definitely recommend.
Best Spanish tapas
Amazing work folks....fast service, great bartending  (aug 21), food was very tasty and good vibe...glad we got seated right at the bar for date night...well be back!!

We were a group of about 20, and were celebrating one of our friends retirement. From reaching out to make the reservation to finally having our dinner, top notch service all the way. We had a wonderful time! The food was great, the staff were very attentive, and the setting was convivial and relaxed. Everything we had hoped for! Special thanks to Alexandra our primary server, and Shaun (co-owner) who took charge of communicating with us to make the booking.
Awesome ambiance, friendly servers.   We went for happy hour and had a nice selection of complimentary small tapas with our drinks.  Highly recommend!

Nice atmosphere and a wonderful place to enjoy a meal with friends or a date. I ve gone a couple of times, and so far it s all been delicious. The patatas bravas are solid, I think they do the pork dishes really well, I feel like they do a generous serving of padron peppers and iberico compared to other places, the cocktails are amazing.
Great tapas, delicious seafood, and creative Mediterranean dishes that I ll definitely be back for. So good!
Seated at the bar until a table opened. Bartending is on point here. We had 6 tapas and we loved it. Must try this place for a piece of Spain in Vancouver.
Delicious food, prompt service and an electric atmosphere, particularly sitting at the kitchen bar watching the talented cooks make everyones meal
Delicious food with impeccable service! We had a beautiful dinner & made our late ferry! Thanks for a great meal!
Get the Cinco Jotas Jamon Iberico de Bellota and sit at the bar. Nicole will take care of you.
The atmosphere and top notch food & drink brings me back to visits to Spain.  The croquettes, oh boy, the best, all of the food is delicious.  Fantastic wine selection.  Great service.

Food was tasty and unique. Very close to the ones in Barcelona. Only negative was out waitress. She was trying to rush our orders and didnt really want to let us enjoy our conversation while tasting our tapas is a slower tempo.
Very authentic place, amazing atmosphere. I highly recommend to try octopus and beef cheek WOW

Amazing spot for what it is, an authentic feel like your in Spain, tapa bar. Great spot to catch up with friends in between meals. Food is a little light, but this isnt intended to be a dinner spot. Great over all though and feels just like the spots ive visited in Madrid.
Loved the food and atmosphere. Didnt know what half of the things on the menu were but our server was super patient and recommended us some great things. All I can say is GET THE VERMUT TO DRINK.
Memories of Spain! Delicious tapas, good wine, a bit pricey but were here for a special occasion and was definitely worth it.
I live out of town (Edmonton) and am in Van 1 week every month. In that week I always stop at Como. The food is top notch, drinks are stellar, atmosphere is great! I will forever love this place!

This place is a gem! A unique vibe thats tough to find elsewhere in the city. Nice wine selections, tasty cocktails and a pitch perfect mix of small, shareable plates make this an ideal spot for revelry. The room has a cozy vibe without feeling cramped and sun-seekers can bask in the rays on the street front patio.

Been here for a first date and 1 year anniversary, and the food and service have always been impeccable. I love a casual room with great product and Como delivers. Get the specials. Take the wine recommendations. 10/10 would recommend.
A very unique and awesome experience. The food and the vibe are both great.

really enjoyed the food here! they offer canned seafood items imported from spain. we ordered the scallops and it was delicious. the octopus was also good, overall a nice place to try some unique spanish plates

I have never eaten here but I did take something to go from here. I really enjoyed it. But I would not have made the purchase if the staff was not friendly. I got a glimpse of the atmosphere here and I must say that I am very impressed. The staff are very friendly and it shows that they love what they do. To me thats extremely important because I have worked in a eatery and I see some of my coworkers were very stressed and very unhappy. The end result? The atmosphere was not inviting and the customers saw it too. So coming to an awesome establishment that is very cheerful and very inviting I can see why its so lively. I highly recommend this place for anyone who wants to unwind with a friend or a partner. I am a soloist so I like to be alone but thats my preference. But either way, one can expect to be pleased with the food, the staff and just overall the whole nine yards. Thank you for my order.
Amazing experience today! Wine, sardines, iberico fuet and eggplant were delicious!
Pork with saffron sauce and black garlic past was so tender and yummy.

Absolutely marvellous. Everything about this place was fantastic when we went the other night. Terrific atmosphere, terrific music, and terrific food. This place is an absolute gem. From the moment we walked in, the staff were exceptional: they were well versed in both the menu and wine options, and EXTREMELY attentive (without being intrusive); we felt like we were guests in someone s home that were being spoiled. This is how dining out should feel. :) We ordered more than a dozen dishes and all of them were incredibly delicious and varied. Hard to make just one recommendation because from what we tried, it seems like the whole menu is top notch (though full disclosure: we did order the eggplant twice). One example: I NEVER eat olives by themselves (though I do enjoy tapenade). However, my experience at Como demonstrated to me that quality does matter, and I not only ended up eating more of the marinated olives than anyone else, but I went home with an entire jar for myself from their grocery shelves! They have an excellent selection of items that you can purchase to take home, (including their fantastic selection of wines). Can t wait to go back and try the rest of the menu. A terrific place to bring friends for a long dinner with drinks. Bravo.
Came here a few weeks ago with a friend for dinner. The crispy eggplant with the honey sauce was out of this world! Pork belly was tender and juicy, the Spanish beer was great too.

We went there a little close to the closing time and they accommodated us right away. Our server Mike made our night. He made the right recommendations and was kind. The food is perfect for a tapas style experience. Everything tasted fresh and we loved our overall experience.

I absolutely love this place. Coming here is not just a place to grab some drinks or a bite. Its an event. A place that invigorates any mood and crests as each new offering makes its way to the table. The food is excellent and the drinks are fresh and delicious. If youve never had tapas before do yourself a favor and try this place. Youll be a regular customer before the bill comes.

An absolutely fantastic dining experience in Vancouver. The tapas-style experience in a casual environment with lots of energy and upbeat vibe is only surpassed by the high-quality and delicious food. Lots of interesting options to try with a variety of choices that will appeal to any palate. Cocktails were bright and refreshing and the staff were helpful and engaging. I appreciated their willingness to guide me through the many choices and ensure I had a wonderful experience. I left full and satisfied and cannot wait to return.
This place is all kinds of awesome! Must try the juvenile squid and patatas bravas (drooling just thinking about it)

My friend and I like to come here after work for drinks as our studio is just across the street. Even if it wasn t, I d make the trek to come to Como. We came in as a group of girls lastnight for my friends birthday and had such a great time! Service was amazing, food and drinks were delicious. My only complaint is that they don t have many vegan options but this is pretty true to Spanish tapas bars. Would definitely come back more for food if they had more veggie options!

The people at Como were so friendly and welcoming! Thankfully, there wasnt a wait for the bar, and the host was extremely helpful:) Trevor, the bartender, was on-point with suggestions and helping me decipher the menu. Every tapas that I ordered was better than expected, and the octopus was tender and delicious! Ill definitely be going back:D
Great food and service. Delicious Spanish tapas

Fabulous service! Quick and friendly with quality food. We loved the carpaccio and shrimp. I can t wait to come back without my husband to try the squid, it looked spectacular. Felt special in a great atmosphere. Our server Sierra was very knowledgeable with intricate menu and made tasty suggestions. The whole staff was attentive smiling and professional. Lovely evening and experience
Eggplant is heavenly. Staff have a super great vibe. Martini s, vermouth, etc are all well executed. Sit at the bar for the kitchen. Well done!!!

I really love this place. Ive been 4 times now and each time it was excellent! The food is fantastic.  Its a great place to go and share food with friends . Cozy space. Happening. Popular. They dont take reservations, but dont despair, because theyll take your number and you go for a beer at one of the two breweries close by while you wait for your text. And everyone that I have met who works there, is genuinely nice. What more could you possibly want?

We waited a long time for a table on the patio on a Friday evening and it was completely worth it. We tried 8 dishes and every single thing was amazing. Our cocktails were very enjoyable and service + atmosphere was spot on.

Will join the legion of people remarking on the service here.   The staff was incredible making me feel like a best friend and the most important person in the restaurant simultaneously.   It s startling and refreshing. Should probably talk about the food.   Having spent a blessed amount of time in Spain, it felt like it was there again.  It s like they crammed a ton of different lovely Spanish concepts into one eccentric menu and it all works.   Biggest hit for the table were the olives stuffed with anchovies and the lamb meatballs. Wine was direct and special.   Space was warm and loud and exciting.   Firing on all cylinders.
Loved the food and vibe. Will be back!

Excellent food and experience. Staff was helpful, food was delicious, and safety protocols were maintained. Great experience! I`d go again, I love their exotic canned sardines :D A little on the pricey end, but amazing experience! Well done!

Im a huge fan of Spanish tapas but was originally a bit concerned when I arrived and looked at the menu. I thought the menu was going to be too limiting, and I didnt know what to expect from the preserves. However, I was pleasantly surprised once the food came and I truly enjoyed every bite. The fried eggplant, Spanish octopus, and chipirones a la planca particularly stood out for me. Highly recommended others to come here for a casual dinner or for date night!

We tried many different dishes in just one visit. Not a bad dish in the bunch. Most are perfect for 2 people. Ate at the stand up bar and chatted with the chefs and other patrons next to us. Time flies when the food is this good. Fun!

Absolutely delicious food! And so much fun having such a variety of small plates. Cool Sherry and Vermouth selections add to the variety of flavors on offer, and the Spanish wine selections are focused and well-chosen.  The conservas list is all imported Spanish seafood, which seems a little silly considering our abundance of incredible local seafood... but I understand that its all in the spirit of offering something different than the salmon, albacore, and sablefish available at every other spot in town.  I would prefer to champion local produce, but if everybody had the same food politics as me the world would be a less interesting place.  Vancouver is certainly made more interesting for having Como!

Delicious cocktails and tasty tapas! Mostly went for drinks since they dont have a ton of vegetarian stuff but the veg dishes are phenomenal. The eggplant (and I dont like eggplant) was really good with rosemary and honey, and the patatas bravas were crisp and perfectly seasoned. Bread with tomato topping was superb.
Good food and friendly service!
Feels like you are in another city! Great atmosphere and awesome service.  Thanks guys.
